intro: Leucadendron squarrosum, commonly known as the silver tree, is a striking evergreen shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray, velvety foliage and striking cone-like inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes. Leucadendron squarrosum plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
